intro: Linosyris krebsii, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through its deep root system and succulent leaves, which help conserve water. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves. Linosyris krebsii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
